attributes.action: New PM not to invoke Article 50 to start the process of the UK leaving the EU .
attributes.additional_details: Nigel Farage, UKIP leader and leading Leave campaigner was quoted recently in the Daily Mirror as saying a 52 - 48 result would be "unfinished business" and hinted if this were the result he would push for a second poll. However the UK is a parliamentary democracy and  therefore parliament should have the determination of whether Britain stays in the EU.
attributes.background: The Referendum on the UK's continued membership in the European Union has no legal force.  The results, with 51.9% to Leave and 48.1% to Remain is not sufficiently conclusive given the irrevocable nature of this decision and the adverse impact it will have for generations to come int he UK.
